Milestones & Accomplishments

Letâ€™s Find Out Whatâ€™s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Connect - Second Webinar: On August 3rd, Tim presented the second Justia Webinar. In this first part of the webinar, Tim discussed the fundamentals of citation and link building for law firm websites and how they relate to rankings in Google organic search results and Google Business Profile.

Justia Elevate AMP: One of our biggest milestones. We successfully added support for AMP to Justia Elevate. With just clicking a button, our clients can benefit from accelerated mobile pages for their whole site.

Justia Elevate Contact Form Integrations: Another feature added to Justia Elevate sites: contact form integrations with third-party services, including Captorra, Clio, Constant Contact, and Legal Intake, among others.

Figma Master Template for Justia Elevate Websites: We released the first Figma Master Template for Justia Elevate that will allow us to create Justia Elevate designs working in a cross-functional team collaboration environment. This will reduce production cycle times and improve output efficiency.

Justia Elevate Theme Picker for Gallery: Weâ€™ve added the possibility of switching the color schema for our Justia Elevate gallery sites with a theme picker, making it super simple.

Completed VPC Migration: We finally completed the migration to the more secure VPC environment for our whole cloud infrastructure. This effort culminated with successfully migrating some of our more complex properties like the Justia Lawyer Directory and Justia Law, among others.

New Mexico Content: Two Mexican federal laws were updated to their latest version: Ley Federal del Trabajo and CÃ³digo Penal Federal. It is worth mentioning that our version is available in HTML, making it even more convenient than the official government source.

Test Cafe for QA Automation: Weâ€™ve integrated Test Cafe into our Automated QA project, making it easier to script QA jobs for Justia Elevate and other React-based applications, which tend to focus more on user interaction.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal
  • Law School Outlines Finally Posted! Check out the new look of our Justia US Law Schools Center, which includes a panel highlighting our case law outlines. These cover 32 topics and over 2,600 cases.
  • Justia Supreme Court Site Updates. We completed roughly 50 pages for the redesigned Justia US Supreme Court center (which is still in progress), covering topics such as landmark Supreme Court cases, the history of the Supreme Court, the stages of a Supreme Court case, and the structure of Supreme Court decisions.
  • New 50-State Surveys. We wrote 50-state surveys on the cannabis laws and bankruptcy exemptions sections. These topics are currently relevant to consumers.
  • Additional Snippets. We have improved the accessibility and clarity of the Landlord-Tenant Law legal guide by writing more snippets underlining critical points in this area.
  • Federal Penal Code Update. Our team continues to update the resources available on the Justia Mexico Portal. Thus, we recently updated the Ley Federal del Trabajo and the CÃ³digo Penal Federal.

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Kevin Rodriguez

Intern IT team

I am a student who wants to gain experience as a full-stack engineer and travel the world. I have taken multiple Python, JavaScript, and other programming skills courses during college on my own. I am interested in companies focused on cloud technology that do their best to achieve people's growth. I am very keen on books like Mistborn and games such as Factorio.

UPCOMING HOLIDAYS

Dates to Remember
Mexicoâ€™s Independence Day
September 16th

September 16th, 1810 is the date when Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, a Catholic priest known as Father Hidalgo, made the first cry for independence. Mexico's Independence Day has become a nationwide celebration, and Mexicans around the globe celebrate the anniversary of the country's independence from Spain.

JUSTIA EMPLOYEE SPOTLIGHT

Stop Motion Summer Workshop by Manu Maldonado

Manu started a workshop for children and youngsters in a community in Cuernavaca, Mexico, to promote stop motion animation. The summer workshop will last one month and is suitable for children and teenagers from 3 to 15 years old.

TEAM ACTIVITY

Escape Room

People from our different teams took part in another edition of the virtual "Escape Game." The objective was to escape or find something hidden in each room in the shortest possible time. To achieve this goal, team members had to apply different skills. We appreciate your enthusiastic participation and commitment to winning. We look forward to seeing you in the next edition!

Factfulness: Ten Reasons Weâ€™re Wrong About the World

Available on Amazon

"This is an eye-opening book. Hans Rosling will walk you through his experiences as a physician, researcher, TED-talk presenter, health adviser for WHO and UNICEF, and more. He will help you overcome biases and see the world with a clearer and broader perspective. He will also give you good reasons to be optimistic about the future of humanity. He will not give you hope, but data and facts."

- Priscila Martinez

Collaborators: Alejandra Medina, Alejandro Moreno, Arturo Jara, Erika Azuela, Haydee Garcia, Jose Ramos, Lauren Moskie, Miguel Berlanga, Rene Peralta, and Zoraida Vallejo.
